revised_title: The Buffy Coat of Inflammatory Disease Blood and its Coagulation
tldr: The author, John Davy, examines the buffy coat of blood in people with inflammatory diseases. He concludes that the buffy coat is mainly due to the increased tenuity of the blood, or the reduced thickness of the coagulable lymph, caused by the inflammation. This finding challenges the common belief that the buffy coat is a result of slow blood coagulation.
